title: Pandora3D: A Comprehensive Framework for High-Quality 3D Shape and Texture Generation
author: Jiayu Yang (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Taizhang Shang (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Weixuan Sun (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Xibin Song (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Ziang Chen (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Senbo Wang (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Shenzhou Chen (Tencent XR Vision Labs), Hongdong Li (The Australian National University), Pan Ji (Tencent XR Vision Labs)
relevance_why: This framework for generating high-quality 3D shapes and textures could inspire new approaches in audio-visual synchronization and enhance the immersive quality of generated audio experiences.
background: Generating high-quality digital 3D assets from various input prompts such as images and text, which involves complex processes for shape and texture creation.
contribution: Pandora3D introduces a dual-component framework for producing high-quality 3D shapes and textures, facilitating efficient creation and integration from diverse input types.
technical_comparison: Previous methods for 3D generation largely depended on single modalities and lacked comprehensive integration of multi-view data. This work improves by leveraging advanced neural architectures and diffusion models to enhance both shape and texture generation across formats.
key_innovation: Integrates a novel consistency scheduler for pixel-wise coherence in texture generation across multiple views, ensuring seamless rendering.
real_world_impact: This framework could significantly streamline the production of digital assets in gaming and VR applications, offering a more efficient and scalable solution for 3D content creators.
limitations: The alternative mesh generation approach struggles with complex geometries, which may limit its applicability to highly detailed models.

new_terms.Variational Autoencoder (VAE): **Variational Autoencoder (VAE)** is a generative model that encodes data into a latent space and reconstructs it, allowing for efficient representation of high-dimensional data.
new_terms.Artists-Created Mesh (AM): **Artists-Created Mesh (AM)** refers to a method of generating 3D mesh structures that mimic artistic design, typically used for simpler shapes.

open_sourcing: The source code and pretrained weights are released at: https://github.com/Tencent/Tencent-XR-3DGen
